defects.description: The useEffect that loads trend data calls historyHook.getTrendData().then() but historyHook is omitted from the dependency array (suppressed with eslint-disable). If historyHook reference changes, the
The getTrendData promise chain lacks a .catch() handler. If the async call fails (e.g., network error), the promise rejection goes unhandled.

On mobile, tab labels are truncated to just the first word using split(' ')[0]. The tab 'How AI Sees Your Content' becomes simply 'How', and 'Score Details' becomes 'Score'. These single-word labels l
Tab labels are truncated on mobile to show only the first word (line 408: tab.label.split(' ')[0]). This results in 'Score', 'How', 'Recommendations', and 'Issues'. The 'How' label (from 'How AI Sees

The dashboard presents the AI summary, executive summary, category chart, quick wins section, tab bar, and tab content all on one scroll. There is no visual hierarchy separation between the 'above the

The Share dialog dropdown (line 187) appears as an absolutely positioned panel but has no focus trap, no aria-modal, and no Escape key handling. Focus can move to elements behind the dropdown, and pre
The Export dropdown button lacks aria-haspopup='true' and aria-expanded attributes. Screen readers cannot announce that this button opens a menu, and the expanded state is not communicated.
The share link <input> (readOnly) at line 224 lacks an aria-label. While there is a preceding text 'Share link:', it is not programmatically associated via htmlFor/id or aria-labelledby.

ReadabilityDashboard uses h3 for 'Quick Wins' at line 337 but the parent ReadabilityPage uses h1 at line 208. This means h3 appears as a direct child of h1, skipping h2 entirely. The tab section label

The AI Visibility Summary section renders AI-generated content summary text (from aiAssessment.contentSummary) directly without any AI disclaimer. The dashboard also renders an executive summary (line

The ReadabilityWeightConfig onChange handler contains a console.log statement: console.log('Custom weights applied:', weights). This is debug logging left in production code. More critically, there is

defects.skip_reason: ReadabilityDashboard eagerly imports all 7 tab components
defects.fix_approach: Convert to React.lazy with lazyWithRetry; load active tab only

The .btn-secondary component (line 135-141) uses hardcoded 'bg-white' with no dark: variant. While there is a .dark .btn-secondary override at line 555-556, any component using 'btn-secondary' class a
defects.skip_reason: btn-secondary dark mode uses CSS specificity override — works correctly

defects.description: The .card-glass component uses 'bg-white/70' and 'border-white/20' (line 200-201). The dark override at line 550-551 changes to 'bg-charcoal-800/70' and 'border-charcoal-700/20'. However the dark over

The .card-gradient class applies 'bg-gradient-to-br from-white to-charcoal-50/50' (line 207) but has no corresponding .dark .card-gradient override anywhere in the dark mode section (lines 540-674). I

The .avatar-ring class uses 'ring-white' and 'ring-offset-charcoal-50' which are light mode colors. No dark mode override exists for .dark .avatar-ring. In dark mode, the white ring and light offset w

The .skip-link class uses 'left-4' for horizontal positioning (line 429) but the focus state uses 'focus:translate-y-4' (line 435). When the skip link becomes visible on focus, it appears at left-4 (1
defects.skip_reason: Skip-link at left-4 briefly visible on focus — acceptable position

defects.description: The .form-group:focus-within label rule (line 747-749) applies 'text-primary-600' when any input inside the form group has focus. There is no dark mode override (.dark .form-group:focus-within label).

The .stagger-children animation (lines 498-509) sets 'opacity: 0' on all children and then animates them in with delays. However, if the animation is interrupted or if the JS rendering is slow, childr

The light mode scrollbar styling (lines 86-98) uses hardcoded colors (#f1f5f9 track, #cbd5e1 thumb) without CSS custom properties. The dark mode scrollbar (lines 101-111) overrides these, but only for

Tab component CSS class (.tabs, .tab, .tab-active) defines visual tab styling without requiring corresponding ARIA roles. The CSS-only approach allows developers to apply tab styling to any element (e
defects.skip_reason: CSS tab classes cannot enforce ARIA — handled at component level
defects.fix_approach: No action: ARIA applied in JSX

defects.description: Dropdown menu CSS classes (.dropdown-menu, .dropdown-item) define dropdown styling without requiring role='menu', role='menuitem', or aria-expanded on trigger elements. The CSS-only definition allows
defects.skip_reason: CSS dropdown classes cannot enforce ARIA
defects.fix_approach: No action: ARIA set in component JSX

defects.description: Modal CSS classes (.modal-backdrop, .modal, .modal-header, .modal-body, .modal-footer) define modal styling without any focus trapping mechanism. The CSS defines z-index and backdrop but provides no f
defects.skip_reason: CSS modal classes cannot implement focus trapping
defects.fix_approach: No action: Focus trapping in modal JS

defects.description: Icon button class (.btn-icon) uses only padding and hover styling but lacks visible focus indicator. While the base .btn class includes focus-visible ring styles, .btn-icon is defined separately witho

defects.skip_reason: CSS search class cannot enforce aria-label
defects.fix_approach: No action: aria-label set in component

defects.skip_reason: CSS nav classes cannot enforce landmarks
defects.fix_approach: No action: Component uses semantic nav
